topic.title: Configure Unattended Installation of Guest OS

body.p: If you chose Unattended Installation, you must supply certain configuration options to be used in the installation.
See also for details of how to configure unattended installation from the command line.

ol.li: Enter the User Name and Password for a default user on the guest OS. On Windows, this will be an administrator. On Linux, the root user will also be created with the same password.

li.p: For Windows guests, enter the Product Key supplied with Windows.
Enter the Host Name for the VM. By default, this is the same as the VM name.
Enter the Domain Name for the VM.

ol.li: Select Install in Background if you want to create the VM without a GUI.

Unattended Guest Additions installation is available for some guests. Select Install Guest Additions if you would like to install the Guest Additions after the OS. Specify the ISO to use, usually the default file that is part of the VirtualBox installation on the host machine.
